headline: Instant Pot Baby Back Ribs
description: Make baby back ribs in an Instant Pot with spice-rubbed pork ribs cooked in beef broth, then oven-baked with BBQ sauce until fall-off-the-bone tender.
name: Instant Pot Baby Back Ribs
recipeIngredient: 0.25 cup barbeque sauce, or as needed

recipeInstructions.text: Combine kosher salt, brown sugar, chili powder, paprika, garlic powder, cayenne pepper, and black pepper in a small bowl.
Cut rack of ribs into 4 equal portions. Rub all sides of each piece with spice mixture.

Pour broth into a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot). Add ribs in a teepee formation. Close and lock the lid. Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set timer for 30 minutes. Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build.
Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil.

Release pressure carefully using the quick-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, about 5 minutes. Unlock and remove the lid. Transfer ribs to the prepared baking sheet. Brush ribs on all sides with barbeque sauce.

Bake in the preheated oven for 7 minutes. Turn ribs and continue baking until meat pulls away easily from the bone, about 7 minutes more. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read 145 degrees F (63 degrees C).

review.reviewBody: I made the ribs for supper in my Instant pot, then under the broiler for 10 minutes. It was a pleasant spice for us. I add salt with my fingers as Iâ€™m an experienced home chef. For learners use 1 tsp Koshersalt, you can always add to your serving! Served with red mashed potatoes with the skin, and steamed carrots! My husband enjoyed his meal. Thank you for sharing your rib spice recipeðŸ˜Š

I didnâ€™t do anything I was supposed to do, but they turned out okay. Basically just wanted to find out how long to cook them in a pressure cooker. Used water, broth doesnâ€™t seem to add anything to the flavor. They would not stand up in a teepee, no worries. Used my own spice, â€˜Slap ya Mamaâ€™. Didnâ€™t broil or place in the oven. And applied BBQ sauce after they were cooked. My dog and I ate them all. I just cook to eat, not for anyone else but my dog and me. It works
quick and easy, plus taste
They were good-but not worth making again for me.

First time for everything , pressure cooking now as a seasoned veteran of one pot cooker, I now know how to get the that 6th star!!!! And not putting 2 tablespoons of anything powder!!!!! . However you author didnâ€™t mention to put ribs on rack so they donâ€™t get wet from liquid ingredients. I could be wrong but as a seasoned home chef the only thing Iâ€™ll would use 2 tablespoons of salt if I was boiling 2 gals of water for potatoes and pasta am sure thereâ€™s more the point is a great rack of rib!!!!
Great recipe for a first timer. I did reduce the salt to 1/2 teaspoon.

These were fabulous as to the cooking method and you could definitely taste the smoky flavoring of the rub. Very tender. I modified the rub substantially so that it would not be so spicy - and it still had a surprising amount of kick - but even more surprisingly, my 5 and 2 year old both ate all of their ribs. It even had a kick for me! Next time, I'd probably modify it a bit more to tone down the spice, but that's just due to personal preference. Also, you don't need to bake the ribs after taking them from the InstantPot. Just put them under the broiler for 10-15 minutes (turn once) to caramelize the sauce. This will be my go-to way of making ribs when I have an Instant Pot on hand. Modification (from what I recall): 1 TBSP salt; 1 teaspoon chili powder; 1/2 tsp cayenne; 1/2 teaspoon pepper
very easy to make! I used a scant 1 tablespoon of Kosher salt

This recipe is part of our regular dinner rotation. I love how easy the instant pot makes these. The first time I went to make these, I didn't have all the ingredients for the rub, so I used McCormick Grill Mates Smokehouse Maple. It made the recipe even easier, so I've stuck with it. I top it with Sweet Baby Ray's BBQ sauce. They truly are fall-off-the-bone delicious!
Great recipe!
Easy to make. Absolutely the best baby back ribs recipe!
Love it just the way it is, but it's also good with the Korean BBQ sauce found on this website.
Very tasty, finishing it in the oven really makes a difference.
Made exactly as listed. So good. So easy. Loved it!
Delicious

Iâ€™ve made these many times and they are always fantastic. I have done exactly as the recipe says, I have used water instead of the beef broth because I didnâ€™t have it and I have used beer instead of broth. I didnâ€™t see much difference so now I just use water. I highly recommend this recipe. I buy the mega-pack of ribs at Costco and cook them in one day, slide out the bones, cut them in sections and package them in airtight zipper lock bags then freeze. The easiest dinner youâ€™ll have. Just take them out of the freezer and put them in the fridge and in the evening I put them on my gas grill or you can put them in the oven.
I wish Iâ€™d read the reviews before cooking this recipe! 2 tbsp of salt is definitely too much! It ruins the ribs.

Excellent! I have made this many times! Moist and juicy.

Instead of 1 cup of beef broth I use 1 cup apple juice. It cuts down on the saltiness. I brush Sweet Baby Rays BBQ sauce on the backside bake 7 mins and then the front and bake another 7 mins. This BBQ sauce goes well with the rub recipe. You get the sweet and then the little bit of heat from the cayenne .Nice sweet and gooey!

I use my own recipe for the rub but otherwise follow the directions in the recipe pretty closely. The ribs really did come out well. I think the temperature given in the recipe is wrong. For ribs to fall off the bone they need to be closer to 180 degrees. Thatâ€™s about what mine were after 15 to 20 minutes in the oven. Also next time I may add some liquid smoke to the beef broth. I miss the smoky flavor I get when I do the ribs on my cold smoker.
I'm new to the instant pot and this was my first real recipe using it. I loved it! And highly recommend this recipe. You won't be sorry!

Is a great reciepe! I cooked it in my Instant pot for 25 minutes. The rub is perfect. Just the right amount of spice and heat. Grilled for about 10 minutes with our families favorite BBQ sauce. Will definitely use this one again and again.

The rib meat was so tender, moist and fall-off-the-bone good. I'm making it tonight for a 2nd time. Delicious was what my husband said and he didn't need to fire up the grill to make them in this frigidly cold weather either. I love my Instapot!!!

This is the best "quick" rib recipe I have found so far. No marinating - just a simple rub a cup of beef broth, some BBQ sauce and you've got fall off the bone ribs from Instant Pot. So simple - so good - will be used over and over again. Thanks for the recipe

You cannot fail making the most delicious ribs ever! Followed to a T (which I generally don't do), and have made multiple times (which I generally don't do). You have to try this! Thanks for the submission!
Made as directed except cut the salt to a heaping Tbsp. My son polished off almost the whole rack, luckily I got a few pieces. He asked if I could make it again this weekend for his gf.

This is the first recipe I made in my InstantPot and it won't be the last time! I made it exactly as written and it was fabulous---fall off the bone tender and perfectly seasoned! I made it with 2 tbsp of Kosher salt as listed and it was not too much, even with Baby Ray's BBQ sauce. You'd never know from tasting it how little time it took to make these!
Very good recipe for a quick rib dinner during the week.

These turned out to be the best ribs. Perfect in every way. Donâ€™t be afraid to put a little crispy ness on them from the broiler. Not gonna lie though, used my own made from scratch BBQ sauce. Simply over the top.

I made these ribs tonight with one exception, I only added 1 tablespoon of kosher salt instead of two. At the end I covered them in Sweet Baby Rayâ€™s BBQ sauce. They were delicious. I will definitely make these again.
It was good, but not quite as juicy as Iâ€™d like. Seemed a little overcooked.
I used boneless pork ribs

This recipe is amazing! 
I didnâ€™t have all the single spices at hand so used Ortega taco seasoning and brown sugar. This will be my go to recipe for ribs from now on! Delicious! Bummer forgot to take picture-hubby raved and toddler didnâ€™t complain a bit! Served with rice and sweet corn!

These were the best ribs weâ€™ve ever had! The secret is to remove the membrane on the backside. Then you do the dry rub. We reduced the salt by 1/2 and that was all we modified. I was told Iâ€™d win any rib contest in the world with these.
Wanted tasty ribs within the hour, and this recipe did the trick! I had no broth so used water, and used a premade rub. Will definitely make again.

Made this (adjusted the salt to tsp) and made a double batch of the seasoning (just in case). They were delicious with the right amount of kick & heat! Broiled the ribs for 2 minutes on each side. Ended up buying another rack and was glad I had extra seasoning. House critics were impressed and stuffed!
Came out beautifully! Family requests a lot!

The ribs turned out great! I only used about 1/2 teaspoon Of cayenne and it was plenty spicy!! 
Unless you like really hot foods, I would take it easy on the cayenne. Otherwise; this is an exceptional recipe!

Turned out good. I used my homemade all pourpose rub instead of the seasoning it called for. They only thing ill do different next time is add some liquid smoke to it. They were super tender and so.ething quick and easy to make.
Mmmm, fall off the bone goodness! Tender and tasty!
They were awesome. Tasty and the bones basically fell off.
Fantastic. Threw them on the grill after the pressure cooker. The rub is rather spicy hot but perfect with a BBQ sauce. My husband loved them.

This was the first time and I've ever made ribs and they were amazing. The time was exactly right. Put them on the Green Egg for 5 minutes to finish them and they were fantastic. Everyone loved them. I also used the recipe for Honey BBQ sauce and it was a perfect fit.

This was the first time and I've ever made ribs and they were amazing. The time was exactly right. Put them on the Green Egg for 5 minutes to finish them and they were fantastic. Everyone loved them. I also used the recipe for Honey BBQ sauce and it was a perfect fit.
Too salty, will add less salt next time. Did not have chili powder on hand so skipped that.

Loved it! Easy as can be. Took the membrane off the back of them first, then followed the recipe.
Our new favorite way to cook baby back ribs!

I wonder if the other cook used regular salt or the kosher salt. Kosher salt is flaky and light so it takes more for a regular recipe. I used my own rub which is very similar. I added my homemade ginger pear jam to sweeten it up.
A little spicy but awesome
Awesome & easy just like the recipe.
We thought this was really good. I thought it was a little on the spicy side but my husband great! I made it exactly like the recipe. I will be making this again!!
It was fall off the bone deeelllllicious!
These turned out really good. I used St. Louis style ribs and they worked well. The family really enjoyed them.
Delicious and very tender. I only left out the cayenne because my little one canâ€™t eat spicy yet! Oh, I also did boneless pork ribs instead.
Great idea to cook the ribs in a instant pot. The ribs came out tender and juicy.
I am omitted the brown sugar But followed everything to a T and they were Off the bone unbelievable delicious. I'm definitely making these again!!
these came out very tender and tasty. Will make again.
Made this exactly by the recipe and they were the best ribs I have ever eaten.
My husband can't get enough of these ribs. This was my first Instant Pot attempt, and it was a huge success! Definitely a keeper!

I made these ribs for dinner tonight. I cooked them for 20 minutes so that the meat wouldnâ€™t completely fall off the bone. I baked them on each side for 7 minutes then broiled the top so the bbq sauce can caramelize. They were very delicious.
The meat falls right off the bones
These ribs were delicious! So easy to make and with the instant pot it cut the time in half. Thank you for this recipe.
The only change I made was adding 1 tbsp of chicken broth powder and baked for 7 minutes only, so not to dry out the ribs.
Very good, nice moist ribs, and so quick !

Very good! I used half the salt and that was plenty. Also cooked 40 minutes in my pressure cooker and let it release naturally. Then 3-4 minutes on each side in the oven. They were fall off the bone good!!
Next time I will add less cayenne pepper. They were a bit spicy for us but otherwise good.

Normally picky family
Who hate eating around bones loved these
No leftovers for me :/
Will make these again
I made it and it was delicious
Fabulous! Ribs, that used to be such a production, now made easy and delicious!

If I could give this 100 stars I would!! They were the best ribs we've ever had along with the easiest recipe! The meat fell off the bones and melted in your mouth! I absolutely LOVE my InstantPot... this was the first thing I tried and it encouraged me to try other InstantPot recipes. Thank you so much for sharing!
I made these almost exactly as the recipe except I left out the cayenne pepper for the rub. They were delicious and really tender. So easy!

It was wonderful! My husband ate the whole thing and was sad because there wasnâ€™t more. I reduced the salt in the recipe because I had read some of the reviews. Next time I will try as is. It needed a little more salt.
Yummy!

Big success! Cooked for 8 people New Years Day and everyone loved them. Made 2 batches, 2 racks of baby back ribs at a time. What was left over on New Years Day were eaten the next day and they said they were even better the 2nd day than the 1st day. This is definitely a recipe I will be making a lot. Quick, easy and very tasty. Quality BBQ restaurant taste and a lot cheaper. I rubbed olive oil on the ribs, mixed all of the spices together and rubbed the spices on both sides of the ribs before cooking.
It was great as is!
Great recipe. Easy to follow.
Absolutely amazing!
Omg this was amazing perfect bbq ribs in record time. Iâ€™ll never spend all day at the smoker again. We used Sweet Baby Rayâ€™s regular sauce to finish it off and it was perfect.
I make this all the time. 2 Tablespoons of Kosher Salt is correct. I use sea salt. Do not use regular table salt. I cut back slightly on the cayenne pepper
This is the reason every person should have an instant pot. To save time, I just use a good, pre-packaged dry rub and a really good bbq sauce.
My family loves this quick and delicious recipe. I double the smoked paprika.
, I have evolved to creating my own dry-rub mix - but the structure and esence of the recipe is excellent!

I followed the recipe exactly, and while I like the dry rub and might keep that part of the recipe, the ribs themselves turned out nearly inedible. They were some of the toughest ribs I've ever made. Do not recommend.
This was a fabulous recipe. I think next time I wonâ€™t add quite so much cayenne pepper. I will definitely make these again!

I cut all of the ingredients for the rub in half for one rack of ribs and had PLENTY. Turned out delicious! I was reminded too late to remove the membrane from the ribs -- next time! I will definitely use this recipe again, with modifications.

*Changed yield to 2 servings and worked from that ingredient list

* Halved rub ingredients for the "hot" spices (paprika, cayenne, chili powder) as my other meal eater was a 4 year old

* Used Sweet Baby Ray's barbecue sauce in the 'Original' flavor



Other than the notation above, made recipe according to directions for my servings. Yes, even the salt. Perfect. I could pull the meat off of the bones, the taste was not too strong in any direction, and even the 4 year old approved. In the way that 4 year olds approve, that they eat 3 bites and say they are good and smile at the taste but then spend the rest of the meal eating the baked beans. ?? But *I* really liked it and am adding to my 'very little drama involved' recipe list. 

I paired with roasted broccoli (since the oven was already at 425 anyway) and baked beans.
Followed the instructions as indicated and it was very tasty. My family was very happy with the results! Will be my go-to recipe. Thank you very much
These were really, really good and easy to make.
Very Yummy! Will do again.
It was very good my kids loved it to
I'll use this recipe as long as there are ribs.
I made it as the recipe stated and got the 5 star approval from my wife. I canâ€™t say I will change anything the next time.
Great ribs! Quick and very little clean up. I doubled the recipe. I have an 8 quart insta pot. This is a keeper.
I used a bottled rub, but the still came out falling off the bone!

adjusted the salt should read 2 teaspoons most probably. Used the trivet in the IP to keep the ribs out of the liquid. Used it to lift them out. Only used 3/4 cup water was still plenty of liquid. Put the ribs under the broiler for 2 minutes after baking so they had more substance & texture like you get when you order out. Used store bought barby sauce from store to baste them prior to the baking part. Imagine you could put on the grill for a bit also.
Some parts were dry but still good and super easy to make!
AMAZING! Thank you!
Easy peasy.

These came out great! I did cheat and use a pre-made rub (Weber Smoky Brown Sugar rub). I did everything else to the letter and it was amazing. My husband usually puts these in a smoker or on the grill in foil. It takes forever. He's sad now because I'll never let him bbq ribs again after this fantastic recipe.
Update: I made these a second time because my son showed up to visit on a night that I didn't plan to make dinner. I had ribs in the freezer so I seasoned them in the frozen state, popped them into the instant pot and added 20 minutes to the cooking time. They came out just as fabulous as the first time from the fresh state.
The ribs turned out great, but the spices were a little overwhelming. I'll probably cut them in half next time. I'll definitely be making again. So easy.
Not quite falling off the bone tender that I expected but delicious nonetheless. Will make it again.
